maml:description.maml:para: Helper for calling the OktaApi. Mainly used internally.
This calls the API and returns the object or error messages. You can use this to call APIs that are not yet in this module.

maml:Description.maml:para: Additional part of Uri to call, after base.
The HTTP method to use
The string version of the body to send for post, put, patch
The API token. Calls Get-OktaApiToken with this value so if blank will use value from Set-OktaOption, or environment, if they exist.
The base API Uri. Calls Get-OktaBaseUri with this value so if blank will use value from Set-OktaOption, or environment, if they exist.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Set to return raw content instead of converting from JSON to objects
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
The string version of the body to send for post, put, patch
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
The HTTP method to use
The API token. Calls Get-OktaApiToken with this value so if blank will use value from Set-OktaOption, or environment, if they exist.
The base API Uri. Calls Get-OktaBaseUri with this value so if blank will use value from Set-OktaOption, or environment, if they exist.
Set to return raw content instead of converting from JSON to objects
Additional part of Uri to call, after base.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.

maml:description.maml:para: Create a new Okta Claim

maml:Description.maml:para: Name for new Claim
Description
RESOURCE (Access token) or IDENTITY (Identity Token)
Value to set
List of scopes to add to new Claim
<!-- #include ./params/authserverIdDescription.md -->
Set to add as inactive
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
<!-- #include ./params/authserverIdDescription.md -->
Name for new Claim
Description
RESOURCE (Access token) or IDENTITY (Identity Token)
Value to set
Set to add as inactive
List of scopes to add to new Claim
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> New-OktaClaim -AuthorizationServerId ausoqi2fqgcUpYHBS4x6 -Name appName -ValueType EXPRESSION -ClaimType RESOURCE -Value app.profile.appName

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> New-OktaClaim -AuthorizationServerId ausoqi2fqgcUpYHBS4x6 -Name test -ValueType EXPRESSION -ClaimType RESOURCE -Value app.profile.appName -Verbose -Scopes "access_token"

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> New-OktaRule -AuthorizationServerId $reliance.id -Name "Allow DRE" -PolicyId $drePolicy.id -Priority 1 -GrantTypes client_credentials -Scopes get_item,access_token,save_item
